newsitem.title: CYPRUS: Iran to re-tender Balal oilfield project - MEES.
newsitem.headline: Iran to re-tender Balal oilfield project - MEES.

text.p: National Iranian Oil Company (NIOC) has launched a new bidding round for the 40,000 barrels per day (bpd) capacity Balal oilfield development, the Middle East Economic Survey (MEES) newsletter reported on Monday.
"The re-bid comes after a British-Canadian consortium failed to line up financing to support a $212 million submission approved by NIOC earlier this year," MEES reported.
Iranian officials said in May that a joint venture between British engineering firm Pell Frischmann and Canada's Bow Valley had been awarded the Balal contract.
"The joint venture broke up a few weeks ago amid a certain amount of reciprocal acrimony," MEES reported.

Potential new bidders for the offshore field included China National Petroleum Corp, British-based Cairn Energy and Monument Oil and Gas. Bow Valley also remained interested in the project, according to MEES.

Under the U.S. Iran Libya Sanctions Act of 1996, the U.S. president had power to slap a range of sanctions against foreign firms that invest $40 million or more a year in the two countries' oil and gas sectors.
Iran has aimed to secure foreign investment in its oilfields to maintain its position as the world's third largest crude exporter in the next decade.
